definition: to scald/to burn (by scalding)/to blanch (cooking)/to heat (sth) up in hot water/to perm/to iron/scalding hot

sentences.english: But for one month, I will wash those pants and iron them.
sentences.chinese: 但未来一个月，我要清洗并且熨烫这些裤子。

sentences.english: I packed it because it didn't need ironing, but I felt wrong.
sentences.chinese: 因为他们不用熨烫我就打包过来了，但我不想穿。

sentences.english: And it is preferred to dye PEA fiber at 110℃. Reduction clearing following dyeing can improve the soaping fastness and ironing fastness.
sentences.chinese: 还原清洗对提高染料的皂洗牢度和干熨烫牢度有利。

sentences.english: Whilst greeting arriving guests, the butler will offer complimentary pressing and shoeshine service.
sentences.chinese: 在迎接客人时，管家应该为客人提供熨烫及擦鞋服务。

sentences.english: Only non-chlorine bleach when needed tumble dry low or line dry use cool iron.
sentences.chinese: 只有无氯漂白时需要低速转笼甩干或用低温熨烫挂凉。

sentences.english: Wrinkled skill will flatten out again if you iron it .
sentences.chinese: 变皱了的绸子，如果经过熨烫可以再变平。

sentences.english: As well as packaging, ironing, sewing, cutting.
sentences.chinese: 以及包装，熨烫，车缝，裁床。

sentences.english: She wore a freshly laundered and starched white shirt.
sentences.chinese: 她穿一件刚刚浆洗熨烫过的白色衬衣。

sentences.english: usually takes his shirts to the laundry but knows how to use an iron and spray starch.
sentences.chinese: 通常把衬衫送到洗衣店去洗，但知道熨烫和上浆。

sentences.english: The shirt drip-dries in seconds,takes little ironing.
sentences.chinese: 这件衬衫滴干快，无需熨烫。

sentences.english: Spray it a little wet may help ironing out the wrinkles.
sentences.chinese: 熨烫时，可适量喷湿，易于烫平。

sentences.english: Then spread the shirt on the ironing board and begin the work.
sentences.chinese: 然后将衣服在熨烫板上铺平，开始熨衣服吧。
如何熨烫金袖一族衬衫？

sentences.english: The robot also ironed Mr. Jing's shirts and made a lunchbox for him every day.
sentences.chinese: 机器人每天也为江先生熨烫衣服和做午餐。

sentences.english: If it needs hand washing, don't bring it. Heck, if it needs ironing, don't bring it.
sentences.chinese: 那些需要手洗和熨烫的衣物，通通不要穿。

definition: to clean (with water or alcohol)/to wipe and wash/to swab/to scrub
to unpick and wash (e.g. padded garment)
